text:
# Nigeria - Conflict: ETS Situation Report #78 (Reporting period: 01/04/2023 to 30/04/2023)

HIGHLIGHTS

- The ETS conducted a demonstration of the CrisisNet quick deployment kit to the WFP TEC Chief Information Officer (CIO) during a visit to the internally displaced persons (IDP) camp in Bama on 11 April. CrisisNet is a connectivity product used in conjunction with Starlink satellite devices to provide mobile security communications services in emergency situations.

- The ETS supported an NGO - Adam Smith International -to conduct a data collection survey across Borno state by providing data connectivity to 70 tablet devices used by their field teams. 

- The ETS is installing a telecommunications tower in Yola to improve the radio network signal coverage.
summary: The Emergency Telecommunications Sector (ETS) conducted a demonstration of the CrisisNet quick deployment kit to the World Food Programme (WFP) CIO during a visit to an IDP camp in Bama, Nigeria. The ETS also provided data connectivity to 70 tablet devices used by an NGO for a data collection survey across Borno state. Additionally, the ETS is installing a telecommunications tower in Yola to improve radio network signal coverage.
